name: Ensure Unused Column is not used
description: This rule checks if any Column table is set as Unused in the Oracle Database(s).
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: PostgreSQL doesn’t support marking table columns as unused.
reference:
The DROP COLUMN form does not physically remove the column, but simply makes it invisible to SQL operations: 
https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/sql-altertable.html
remediation: PostgreSQL doesn’t support marking table columns as unused. However, when running the ALTER TABLE… DROP COLUMN command, the drop column statement doesn’t physically remove the column; it only makes it invisible to SQL operations
remediationSample:
1 and 2
Remove both ALTER TABLE ... SET UNUSED ... statements.

3.
ALTER TABLE EMPLOYEES DROP COLUMN COMMISSION_PCT;
4.
ALTER TABLE EMPLOYEES
   ADD (CONSTRAINT EMPLOYEES_CHECK_JOB_ID CHECK (JOB_ID > 0));
alternativeName: Ensure Unused Column is not used

technicalCriteria.name: Database Migration - Oracle Database to PostgreSQL
